preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This is the manual for the PHP library RapidDataMapper.

I created RapidDataMapper as my exam-work for my last year in upper secondary school, as I already had experimented with Object-Relational-Mappers before then. Previous experiments utilized an existing database abstraction and added additional features to that. But I wanted something more adaptable, better performing and finally to have better control over the whole stack, from the calls to mysql_query() and upwards.

At school we had to do an assignment which spans a whole year, it should take around 100 hours totally (I have probably exceeded that requirement :) ). I figured; why not do an ORM as assignment, when I will create one even if I don't do it as an assignment?

As examples I will use a simple database which is cataloguing music. This is because examples with forums or similar thins with users etc. have been used a lot and I want to do something different. The examples are still usable in a real-life application.
And of course I will use names from bands I listen to a lot :)
